channel.title: Setcap notice when upgrading
channel.description: Beginner question. I see this notice when upgrading “run: setcap -r — /bin/ping”. I tried to run that and it says “unable to set CAP_SETFCAP effective capability: operation not permitted” … I’m tempted to try running it with sudo, but I remember reading some kicksecure post advising against blindly using sudo. Someone please tell me what to do.

item.title: Setcap notice when upgrading
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Ignore this.

Output is telling you what’s happening. It’s not a request for the user
to perform actions.

Read full topic

item.title: Setcap notice when upgrading
item.dc:creator: willdrozdowski
item.description:
Beginner question. I see this notice when upgrading “run: setcap -r — /bin/ping”. I tried to run that and it says “unable to set CAP_SETFCAP effective capability: operation not permitted” … I’m tempted to try running it with sudo, but I remember reading some kicksecure post advising against blindly using sudo. Someone please tell me what to do.

Read full topic
